page.title: 10 Rural Policeman in Wilby
page.content: In the autumn the farmers in this area burn the stubble of their crops and before starting the policeman has to be informed so that he can see that all the safety rules for containing the fires have been obeyed. The rural policeman checks that licences have been obtained for any guns used in his area either for containing vermin or shooting for sport. He also ensures that the Protection of Birds Act is upheld and that no cruel sports such as badger baiting, dog fighting or cock fighting are performed. Poaching and cattle rustling where the animals can be killed and sold as meat or taken alive & sold are sometimes problems he has to deal with. The rural policeman tries to be involved in all village activities & gives protection & help to the isolated farms.
